title: The fall of Syria's Bashar al-Assad, accidental president, failed modernizer and bloodthirsty despot
summary: President Hafez al-Assad's second son found himself thrust into power after the death of his elder brother. He withstood the civil war that followed the 2011 Arab Spring at the cost of a bloody civil war. On Sunday, he was finally forced to flee by a coalition of rebels.

title: The fall of Syria's executioner, finally
summary: At the head of a country bled dry by decades of neglect and an appalling civil war, President Bashar al-Assad was ousted from power in just a few days by a lightning offensive led by the Islamists of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham. A Herculean task now awaits the Syrians, who have freed themselves.

title: How the alliance between the Assad regime and Hezbollah backfired on them
summary: The Syrian dictatorship had long relied on the decisive support of the Lebanese militia until both sides spectacularly paid the price for such an alliance.

title: 'Peace through strength is possible,' says Volodymyr Zelensky, after meeting Donald Trump and Emmanuel Macron at the Elysée
summary: The American president-elect was accompanied by his advisers for the Middle East, but not for Ukraine.

title: South Korea sinks further into political uncertainty
summary: In the absence of the necessary quorum, the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol, on Saturday, following his decision to impose martial law, failed to pass.

title: Fat tires and honking bells: when bicycles turn into SUVs
summary: Unbridled speedsters are storming urban bicycle paths, turning calm, sustainable mobility into a dangerous free-for-all.

title: Macron hails fall of 'barbaric' Assad regime in Syria, Biden calls it 'moment of risk' for the Middle East
summary: Rebel group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and allied factions seized swathes of Syria from government hands, including the cities of Aleppo, Hama and Homs in an offensive that started November 27.

title: Notre-Dame de Paris re-opening in pictures
summary: The Paris cathedral's grand re-opening weekend kicked off on Saturday, with a liturgical ceremony marked by the blessing of the monument's doors and the 're-awakening' of its organ.

title: Ghana's ex-president Mahama returns with historic election win
summary: The West African state's former president won a comeback election, as the ruling NPP, whose last term was marked by economic turmoil, conceded defeat. Official vote tallies are still arriving.

title: Mbappé speaks for first time about reports of a rape investigation in Sweden
summary: The Real Madrid star spoke about the case publicly in an interview that aired Sunday on French TV station Canal Plus. Several Swedish media reported in October that Mbappé was the subject of a rape investigation in Stockholm. Mbappé's legal team has dismissed those reports as false.

title: What's the carbon footprint of a Christmas tree?
summary: The greenhouse gas emissions linked to Christmas trees are difficult to quantify. But they are minimal, especially compared to the overall carbon footprint of our holiday behavior.

title: Cuisine as a site of Palestinian resilience
summary: For a people with a history of war and displacement, food has always been a major component of cultural identity. With his book of traditional recipes, chef Fadi Kattan celebrates the Palestinian culinary tradition.

title: Thousands of pro-EU protesters march on Georgia Parliament
summary: The nation has been engulfed in turmoil since the governing Georgian Dream party declared victory in a disputed October 26 election. The government said last week it would suspend talks to join the European Union, which sparked more protests.

title: Notre-Dame reopening: Macron celebrates France's builders amid a political and meteorological storm
summary: The rains caused by Storm Darragh did not deter the 2,400 guests expected at Notre-Dame's reopening ceremony on Saturday. The French president delivered a brief speech to an audience of patrons, heads of state and resigning ministers.

title: Bluesky: Misinformation looms over young social media
summary: User numbers of this 'old-style Twitter' have exploded since the election of Donald Trump. The presence of a few 'trolls' and Kremlin mouthpieces among them may cast doubt on its ability to remain a healthy forum for discussion for long.

title: Romania's presidential election canceled over TikTok disinformation investigation
summary: Pro-Russian candidate Calin Georgescu said the decision amounted to an 'organized coup d'état'. Democracy was brought 'to its knees,' pro-European Elena Lasconi said.

title: The expansion of liquefied natural gas, a potential 'climate disaster,' is being fueled by financial investments
summary: The 63 LNG export terminals planned between now and 2030 could emit over 10 billion tons of CO2 by then – almost the equivalent of annual emissions from coal-fired power plants, according to the NGO Reclaim Finance.

title: On the slopes of the world's largest indoor ski resort in Shanghai, fun is more important than the climate
summary: The L + Snow Indoor – with its 60-meter mountain, artificial snow and lifts – attracts curious visitors and enthusiasts, indifferent to the high energy costs of the huge refrigeration warehouse.

title: EU, Mercosur seal free trade deal in a setback for France
summary: After 25 years of negotiations, the European Commission and five South American nations have agreed on a text to facilitate trade. The agreement still has to be validated by the member states and the European Parliament. France is opposed to the treaty.

title: Australian police seek three suspects in Melbourne synagogue blaze
summary: Officials from the federal and state police as well as Australia's intelligence agency met Monday and concluded that the fire was 'likely a terrorist incident', the police chief said.

title: 'The Day of the Jackal' on Prime Video features Eddie Redmayn as a hitman in the digital age
summary: Based on the novel by Frederick Forsyth, Ronan Bennett's series sees the actor slip into the shoes of a virtuoso assassin.

title: Prime Minister of Pacific nation Tonga abruptly resigns
summary: Siaosi Sovaleni told parliament on Monday he would quit just moments before lawmakers decided his future in a vote of no confidence. The prime minister is stepping down in the wake of a power struggle with the royal family.

title: Against Syria's Bashar al-Assad, world powers hesitated for more than a decade
summary: The refusal, in August 2013, of then-US president Barack Obama to intervene against the Syrian dictator left the way clear for Russia and Iran.

title: Maksym Boutkevytch's two years of captivity and interrogation in Ukraine
summary: Captured by the Russian army in June 2022 and released in October 2024, the Ukrainian peace activist, who volunteered to serve in the aftermath of the invasion, talks about the detention regime applied by the Russian authorities, who denied him prisoner-of-war status.

title: In China, 'the online expression of anger over menstrual pads has taken a very political turn'
summary: In a country where the existence of a feminist movement is perceived as a threat by the authorities, users' anger over the defective quality of menstrual pads has taken a political turn, reports Beijing correspondent Harold Thibault in his column.

title: When bûche de Noël cake turns into work of art
summary: Gone are the days of small tree trunks adorned with meringue elves. The Yule log, or bûche de Noël, has become a ritual challenge for pastry chefs eager to show off their skills.

title: Syrians celebrate the end of the Assad family's half-century rule
summary: Islamic-led rebels reached the Syrian capital, Damascus, on Sunday, after a lightning offensive. President Bachar al-Assad has reportedly fled.

title: Jay-Z accused of raping teen with Diddy in civil suit
summary: An updated complaint in a civil case against rapper Sean Combs known as 'Diddy' alleges that the two musicians raped a 13-year-old girl at an after-party following the MTV Video Music Awards in September of 2000. Jay-Z denied the claims.

title: Director accused of abusing French star Adèle Haenel goes on trial
summary: Christophe Ruggia is accused of sexually assaulting the actress in the early 2000s when she was under 15 and he was in his mid to late 30s.

title: Bashar al-Assad's downfall is a major setback for Russia
summary: The Syrian president has taken refuge in Moscow. In 2015, Kremlin support enabled him to regain control of a large part of the country. This time, the Russian army, concentrating on the Ukrainian front, has hardly intervened against the Islamist rebels.

title: Assad and his family are in Moscow, Russian state media report
summary: Russian state news agencies also reported that ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his family have been given asylum.

title: Fall of Assad: In Germany, Austria and Greece, a jubilant Syrian diaspora cautious about a possible return
summary: Around 5,000 people gathered in Berlin to celebrate the fall of the Syrian regime on Sunday, December 8. There were 10,000 people gathered in Vienna and 1,000 in Athens.

title: South Korean president banned from leaving country
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol has been banned from leaving South Korea days after surviving a parliamentary impeachment motion following a brief imposition of martial law.

title: Macron resumes talks with party leaders in search of new prime minister
summary: The Greens, Communists and a group of independents were set to meet with the president as Monday as he consults parties in view of forming a government.

title: The rise of Abu Mohammed al-Jolani: From jihadist in Iraq to Syria's new strongman
summary: After fighting with Al-Qaeda in Iraq and Syria, the leader of the Islamist armed group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham went on to discipline the Syrian rebels and reassure religious minorities. But his real intentions remain an enigma.

title: In Assad's fall, the US sees validation of its Middle East strategy
summary: Joe Biden hailed the fall of Bashar al-Assad as a 'moment of historic opportunity.' Voices within both the current administration and among those close to President-elect Donald Trump, have hailed the possibility of lasting damage to Iran and its regional proxies.

title: Haiti gang-related violence kills over 180 in capital, says UN
summary: United Nations human rights commissioner Volker Türk reported that 'at least 184 people were killed in violence orchestrated by the leader of a powerful gang,' who reportedly targeted voodoo practitioners.

title: In China, luxury and fine crafts diplomacy
summary: Major French brands are funding exhibitions and museums in China to regain influence and win back buyers.

title: In Georgia, anger spreads beyond the capital: 'We've never seen such a treacherous government!'
summary: More than 40 towns and villages have joined the protest movement against the government, which has suspended the process of joining the European Union until 2028.

title: BP to 'significantly reduce' renewables investment
summary: BP chief executive Murray Auchincloss has scaled back on the group's key climate targets, putting more emphasis on oil and gas to boost profits.

title: China probes Nvidia for 'violating' anti-monopoly law
summary: China has launched an investigation into US chip giant Nvidia for allegedly violating its anti-monopoly laws, state broadcaster CCTV said.

title: Finland's President Stubb: Europe must choose between 'Yalta moment and Helsinki moment'
summary: Finnish President Alexander Stubb says in an interview that Vladimir Putin's Russia must pay a price for its war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: Romania's far right challenges annulment of presidential election
summary: Romania's second electoral round, between pro-Russian candidate Calin Georgescu and his pro-European opponent Elena Lasconi, was annulled by its Constitutional Court, due to breaches of financial transparency and a 'massive disinformation' campaign on social media.

title: At the UN desertification conference, nature-based solutions to halt land degradation
summary: The planet's climate is drying out over three-quarters of its landmass, according to a report by the UN Convention on Desertification published on Monday.

title: Several European countries suspend Syrians' asylum requests
summary: Germany, Sweden, Denmark, and Norway have all frozen decisions on Syrian asylum requests, France is due to announce similar measures, and Austria has begun preparing a 'deportation program.'

title: Syria after Assad, a half-festive, half-worried anarchy: 'You won't believe where I am. We're going home!'
summary: While many Syrians are elated to finally be able to return home, many others have begun fleeing the country. In Damascus, residents waver between fear and subdued euphoria.

title: Man arrested over killing of US health insurance CEO
summary: A man with a weapon 'consistent with' the gun used to kill UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson has been arrested in Pennsylvania.

title: 'Emilia Perez' leads Golden Globe nominations with 10
summary: After winning at Cannes, Jacques Audiard's musical about a Mexican drug lord who transitions to life as a woman is marching toward more prizes in Los Angeles.
